text: How to decorate gingerbread lego men?
This one is a Ninjago man.

Firstly, you need to make your royal icing
and then you can just use a normal Ziploc
bag and cut the corner off.

You need to pipe around the edge of your lego
man.

For each color you need to do this, so if
you have more than one color on your lego

man, then you need to do it for the other
color too.

You can do some details if you want, and he
also has a black belt, so we'll leave room

for that, and a dragon we can ice that one
on later.

Okay, once you've done that, and you leave
it completely to dry -- so I'll just move

that one over -- once you've left it to dry,
then you need to flood-fill the areas.

So this is exactly the same icing, I've just
watered it down with a little bit of water,

mixed it around, and so now what we have is
a really runny royal icing.

And what you do is you just fill in the area
with the runny royal icing.

That doesn't have to be right to the edge,
because you can spread it out.

The reason you fill it like this and not just
with your normal royal icing is that you can't

get the normal royal icing smooth, because
it's too viscous.

So it won't spread into a nice, smooth, shiny
surface.

Once that's completely dried, using an edible
marker we draw on the eyes; and that is your
Ninjago man.

And what you can do, if you've got something
very detailed that you're doing, you can let

it dry, and then use your thick icing again
and ice details on over the top.
